job_title: Customers & Communities Manager in Ipswich, England
pros: Orwell are a fantastic company to work for. Who since starting have been incredibly welcoming. I have never worked for a company who really put people first and are so true to their values.
cons: Being a smaller organisation there is less budget to go around than some Housing Associations. However this makes us more focused on the really important work.

pros: Some of the best reasons I feel working for OHA is they allow you to be you, from not having to wear a uniform (unless for PPE) to being able to manage your own day to day workload, you are given the freedom to carry out your work knowing that there is support face to face and over the phone on a daily basis. We have a diverse, wonderful team of colleagues here. We have an Employee Voice and Wellbeing Group set up to support colleagues. The best thing has to be the staff conferences where we meet with all staff throughout OHA and just have a great time!! Check out some of the photo's on LinkedIn. This is not an all all work, no play company. OHA is a collaboration of lots of Teams, everyone is willing to help.
cons: If I am to mention any downsides it would be that offices and schemes are spread across the county and as such much of the interaction is not face to face. However we do use WPFB to stay connected and hear about daily fun events happening in different areas and you can always have a chat via Teams.

review_title: People Focused, Ambitious, Collaborative and Effective
pros: This organisation has the kindest, sweetest and most helpful people I’ve come across anywhere. I can truly say that everyone I’ve worked with here has been nothing but helpful to me and more importantly to the customers they work with. Everyday is a fresh challenges are faced but the organisation really does support you in a way that makes you feel part of a family. I love the fact that, although people are paid differently for different responsibilities, there is very little ineffective top down management and much more listening, lineal and effective ways of management. My colleagues treat me with respect and kindness and compassion and the core values, work on ethnicity, inclusion and diversity and holistic working practices shown at different scenes makes me feel proud to be a part of Orwell.
cons: The organisation could shout out a bit more about it’s people focused working environment. Because it is so good. All large organisations are bound to have problems and glitches everywhere. But these throw up solutions too! I can’t think of any cons other than the endemic nationwide problem of pay for support workers which requires political will rather than just one organisation’s

pros: amazing colleges support as and when required lovely setting training provided friendly and welcoming
cons: no cons at all or complaints

pros: Great leaders Inclusiveness Well being Agile working

pros: Great work culture. Inclusive, welcoming and supportive team.
cons: I have not found any cons yet.

job_title: Property Services Assistant in Ipswich, England
pros: I have worked for Orwell for coming up to 5 months now and I can't fault them as an employer. It is a very busy environment, but Orwell have a lot in place for staff wellbeing. It is obvious that their customers are at the core of what they do. I feel valued as an employee and I know that my managers want to further my skills as much as possible to succeed within Orwell or outside of it. I feel very lucky and grateful to work for them.
cons: I can't really fault them as an employer.

job_title: Head of Communications and Marketing in Ipswich, England
pros: Great culture, inclusive, welcoming, supportive and customer led.
cons: Really busy role but positive direction of travel.

pros: Flexible, encouraging, excellent employer. Care about their employees.
cons: I can not think of any.

pros: My colleagues are awesome and the culture is one of kindness and valuing people.
Looking after tenants and their families
cons: Long hours, poor management, not enough time with tenants to give care needed

job_title: Director of Resources and Growth in Ipswich, England
pros: Great place to work which makes such a difference to people across the Eastern region who benefit from all the services that Orwell provide. Care and support for customers is brilliant and also translates across into how it feels to be an employee.
cons: Because the work makes such a difference to people - it's sometimes too easy just to keep working

review_title: Forward thinking organisation with great culture
pros: Really committed employees who are really customer focussed and want to make a difference to their communities. Supportive environment
cons: No downsides that I can think of

pros: Agile working, great offices, brilliant team, extremely supportive to new employees, excellent cultural approach
cons: Difficult to get to know all the team but that’s due to Covid preventing us getting together

review_title: Challenging and rewarding place to work
pros:
Orwell has a great team of people who care about their colleagues, the company and most importantly our customers.
Continued growth and expansion of the business which brings great challenges and opportunities.
Flexible working arrangements to help with work / life balance.
cons: Perhaps Orwell can operate a little lean at times and more people resource would help.
